page.title: 02FIRST RUDDINGTON CHURCH
page.content: {FLAWFORTH CHURCH There was a Roman Villa at this crossroads of footpaths and then a church was built for the four villages.{RUDDINGTON, EDWALTON, {PLUMTREE AND BRADMORE. {RUDDINGTON}had a chapel built in the village in 1479 and then only burials were held at {FLAWFORTH.}There is a funny shaped bush called the Resting Bush on {FLAWFORTH LANE}which was shaped by the coffins resting on it. In 1773 the disused church spire fell down and the church was dismantled. Many of the stones were used by villages for building. Now all that is left are a few gravestones but it has been Archaelogicaly surveyed and will show the outlines of the church and villa when the work is finished.
